name: Upside-Down Face
baseMeaning: A classic smiley turned upside down.
tldr: The passive-aggressive king. Means 'I'm fine' (not fine), frustration, or sarcasm.

contextMeanings.meaning: Expressing frustration while pretending to be fine.
Sarcasm or expressing the opposite of what you're saying.
contextMeanings.example: Love being stuck in traffic ðŸ™ƒ

contextMeanings.meaning: Things are chaotic or going wrong.
contextMeanings.example: Spilled coffee on my laptop ðŸ™ƒ

contextMeanings.meaning: Playful or silly - rare genuine usage.

platformNotes.note: The go-to for sarcastic or passive-aggressive tweets.
Often signals that the sender is frustrated but trying to be casual.
Can come across as passive-aggressive in work contexts.

generationalNotes.note: Master of passive aggression - rarely used positively.
May think it's just a silly/playful smile.

warnings.title: Passive-aggressive tone
warnings.description: This emoji almost always carries a sarcastic or frustrated undertone. Using it can escalate tension.
